div.div: Your session will expire in 0 minutes.

p.span: Today, Governor Kim Reynolds announced that all schools in Iowa will remain closed through the end of the school year to help prevent the further spread of COVID-19.

This announcement will continue to affect all Van Buren County Community School District programming, including before- and after-school activities, all athletic and extracurricular practices and competitions, and all weekend events. It is our hope that we will be able to reschedule prom and graduation for sometime this summer, but we do not yet know how these events will look. Summer sports have yet to be cancelled, and we are told we will have more guidance no later than June 1.

I know this decision has caused a great deal of concern and disappointment for our students, staff, and families. The pandemic arrived quickly, and when we first were directed to close our school buildings in March, we did not realize it would be the last time we would see our students in person this school year. Please know that we share in your disappointment.

Per our district calendar, the last day of school for students is Friday, May 22. We will continue with virtual learning and learning packet handouts on Thursdays, until that date, just as we have over the past several weeks. We encourage all families to keep their students engaged in these activities to ensure learning continues to take place through the end of the school year. Our staff is ready to assist all families in these efforts, as well.

We need our families’ support in engaging students in the learning resources we have provided. Please encourage and assist your children with learning opportunities as much as you can. Please know that while learning is important, so is the mental health and relationships that exist in your home. Please continue to do as much as you can while attempting to make learning a fun event. If it feels like a chore, stop, take a break and come back to it tomorrow.

We will continue school lunch services through the extended school closure, as well. Currently, we are delivering a week’s worth of meals and breakfasts each Wednesday. These deliveries ensure meals for each school day through May 22. The last day of meal delivery will be on Wednesday, May 13 and will include 8 meals and breakfasts.

More details will come in the coming weeks regarding locker clean out, gathering any school supplies and other personal belongings, turning in technological devices and textbooks as well as any other pertinent details.

Once again, thank you for your patience, understanding, and flexibility during this time. We will get through this together. Please continue to stay safe, practice social distancing, and remain at home as much as possible. Have a blessed day!.
